Award.AbstractNarration:
CBET 1246788
Sharon C. Long
University of Wisconsin-Madison

This is a travel grant for the CBET grantee to attend and present at the CBET Grantee Conference in Baltimore, June 6-8, 2012

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant was used for travel to the NSF 2012 CBET Grantee Conference "Advancing Global Engineering through Discovery & Innovation." The NSF 2012 CBET Grantee Conference was held from Wednesday, June 6, 2012 to Friday, June 8, 2012 at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore and the Baltimore Convention Center. The PI was able to solicit input from conference attendees on the optimal strategies for dissemination of research results and logical future research paths associated with the project titled “TT Virus: A Potential Indicator of Human Enteric Viruses in Source and Drinking Waters” through her poster presentation. Modifications to the research plan included conducting eubacteria 16S rRNA and adenovirus analyses on archived, frozen field samples. These added analyses added interpretation value to the results. These project outcomes have strengthened the work being conducted on NSF Federal Award Number 0853459.

Additional educational programs were developed as a result of connections made at the conference. The PI will participate in an Undergraduate Course at Michigan Technological University as a "scientific client" for a class small group project. The computer engineering students will be developing a cell phone application that might be used by water quality managers and beach rangers to assess recreational water quality and microbial risk to swimmers.
